column4: As of 7.10, does Ubuntu run the same kernel for the 32-bit distros as the x86_64/AMD64 distros?
hmm... I have 4GB of RAM in my Pentium D system but Linux is only seeing 3.2GB of it. Is that a limitation of my OS or a limitation of my hardware?
is some of it set aside for graphics?
I'm not sure--but when I only had 2GB, none was set aside because the OS saw the full 2GB.
